[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/value_serde.rs] [Function: serialize()] [Computational DoS] Can an attacker craft values that cause serialize() to consume excessive CPU through pathological BCS encoding patterns, even if size limits are enforced? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/value_serde.rs] [Function: deserialize()] [CPU Exhaustion] Can malicious bytes cause deserialize() to enter expensive parsing loops in BCS format decoding, causing validator slowdown? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/value_serde.rs] [Function: deserialize()] [Type Safety Breach] Can deserialize() create Value instances that violate Move's type system invariants, such as structs with wrong field counts or mistyped fields? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/value_serde.rs] [Struct: DeserializationSeed] [Layout Mismatch] If the MoveTypeLayout provided to DeserializationSeed doesn't match the actual bytes, can this create memory corruption or type confusion? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/value_serde.rs] [Struct: SerializationReadyValue] [Layout Validation] Does SerializationReadyValue validate that the Value matches the provided MoveTypeLayout before serialization, or can mismatches cause undefined behavior? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/value_serde.rs] [Function: serialize()] [Variant Type Confusion] For enum/variant types, can an attacker craft values with invalid variant tags that serialize successfully but violate type invariants? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/value_serde.rs] [Function: serialize()] [Non-Deterministic Serialization] Can floating-point rounding, HashMap iteration order, or other non-deterministic factors cause different validators to produce different serialized bytes for the same value? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/value_serde.rs] [Function: deserialize()] [Non-Deterministic Deserialization] Can different BCS library versions or platform-specific behavior cause deserialize() to produce different values from the same bytes across validators? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/value_serde.rs] [Struct: ValueSerDeContext] [Configuration Divergence] Can different validators configure ValueSerDeContext differently (e.g., different max_value_nested_depth), causing divergent execution? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/value_serde.rs] [Function: with_legacy_signer()] [Security Downgrade] Does legacy_signer mode disable important security checks for signer serialization, creating vulnerabilities in backward compatibility code paths? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/value_serde.rs] [Field: legacy_signer] [Mode Confusion] Can an attacker force serialization to use legacy_signer mode when it shouldn't, bypassing modern security validations? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/value_serde.rs] [Function: new()] [Default Configuration] Does the default ValueSerDeContext::new() configuration provide adequate security, or can missing extensions lead to vulnerabilities? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/value_serde.rs] [Struct: FunctionValueExtensionWithContext] [Lifetime Safety] Are lifetimes properly enforced to prevent the context from outliving the extension reference, avoiding use-after-free bugs? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/value_serde.rs] [General] [Thread Safety] Is ValueSerDeContext safe to use from multiple threads simultaneously, or can concurrent serialization/deserialization cause data races? (High)
